{{cpp/regex/regex_traits/title|length}}
{{cpp/regex/regex_traits/navbar}}
{{ddcl|1=
static std::size_t length( const char_type* p );
}}

Calculates the length of a null-terminated character sequence, that is, the smallest {{tt|i}} such that {{c|1=p[i] == 0}}.

Standard library specializations of {{lc|std::regex_traits}} execute {{c|std::char_traits&lt;CharT&gt;::length(p);}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|p|pointer to the first element of the null-terminated character sequence}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The length of the null-terminated character string.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;regex&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::regex_traits&lt;char&gt;::length("Кошка") &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; std::regex_traits&lt;wchar_t&gt;::length(L"Кошка") &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
10
5
}}
